        Creates a bordered panel with a vertical layout
        Parameters:
        border - 0 = NONE and 1 = PLAIN

        Creates a panel with a vertical layout and a NONE border

      • Element

        public Element(int orientation,
               int border)
        Creates a bordered panel with the specified layout.
        Parameters:
        orientation - 0 = Panel.VERTICAL and 1 = Panel.HORIZONTAL
        border - 0 = NONE and 1 = PLAIN

      • Element

        public Element(int orientation,
               Panel panel,
               int border)
        Creates a bordered panel with the specified layout and adds it to a panel.
        Parameters:
        orientation - 0 = Panel.VERTICAL and 1 = Panel.HORIZONTAL
        panel - the parent Panel that this panel will be added to
        border - 0 = NONE and 1 = PLAIN

      • Element

        public Element(int border,
               java.lang.String title)
        Creates a bordered panel with a vertical layout and a title.
        Parameters:
        border - 0 = NONE, 1 = PLAIN, 2 = TITLED and 3 = BOLD_TITLED
        title - the title to be displayed with the border.

      • Element

        public Element(int orientation,
               int border,
               java.lang.String title)
        Creates a panel with the specified layout, border and title.
        Parameters:
        orientation - 0 = Panel.VERTICAL and 1 = Panel.HORIZONTAL
        border - 0 = NONE, 1 = PLAIN, 2 = TITLED and 3 = BOLD_TITLED
        title - the title to be displayed with this border

      • Element

        public Element(int orientation,
               Panel panel,
               int border,
               java.lang.String title)
        Creates a panel with the specified layout, border and title and adds it to the given panel.
        Parameters:
        orientation - 0 = Panel.VERTICAL and 1 = Panel.HORIZONTAL
        panel - the parent Panel that this panel will be added to
        border - 0 = NONE, 1 = PLAIN, 2 = TITLED and 3 = BOLD_TITLED
        title - the title to be displayed with this border

                             java.lang.String title)
        Sets the border of this Element.

        border - 0 = NONE, 1 = PLAIN, 2 = TITLED and 3 = BOLD_TITLED

      • getSpacing

        public int getSpacing()
        Returns the spacing on this BorderPanel.
        Returns:
        the value representing the spacing on this BorderPanel

      • setSpacing

        public void setSpacing(int spacing)
        Sets the spacing on this BorderPanel. Higher values create more space around the edge of the panel.
        Parameters:
        spacing - the value representing the spacing on this BorderPanel

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int width,
                    int height)
        Sets the minimum, maximum and preferred sizes of this Element to the specified size.
        Overrides:
        setSize in class java.awt.Component
        Parameters:
        width - the int representing width of the component
        height - the int representing height of the component

      • setAlignment

        public void setAlignment(float x,
                         float y)
        Sets the alignment of this Element. Values closer to 0 position objects to the left and top, which values closer to 1 position objects closer to the right and bottom.
        Parameters:
        x - a float indicating the position of added objects. Values closer to 0 position objects to the left while values closer to 1 position them to the right.
        y - a float indicating the position of added objects. Values closer to 0 position objects towards the top while values closer to 1 position them towards the bottom.
